title: Unable to write email to the mailbox - this was never solved until now
content:
I think I solved the "Unable to write email to the mailbox" error. I read all posted solutions that were not of real help, like folder rights, and so on. I had the same issue today, and realized that the mail file size and the writing rights are not the real issue, and reinstalling software As Administrator did not help at all.

I noticed that when I installed the latest version of Thunderbird, the headers would not load, but I coud load messages only at 352 messages at the time until the "write error" came up. The Gmail Inbox covered couple years, and the mail file hidden deep within Windows 11 Roaming folder was over 3GB. The Thunderbird account was installes as POP.

How the installation got fixed: 1. Just in case, I copied the Mail folder from C:\Users\name\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\zkwmmr59.default-release\Mail 2. Uninstalled Thunderbird, rebooted and installed As Administrator (original version was just installed by file Open). After installation software came up with the POP account, and the original write error. 2. I removed present Gmail account Settings\Account\Settings\Account Actions\Remove Account, and then in Account Actions added MAPI account for Gmail.

This has resolved the write to folder prohibition issue, doesn't make much sernse, but it works, and software started to download headers, and now continues to download all messages, no issues observed. So as it looks now Thunderbird, v.115.01 fails with POP settings, but works with Gmail MAPI.
creator: 2kkrys

title: Contacts do not sync properly
content:
I installed TB 116b. Added 3 gmail accounts and 1 outlook account. The emails sync flawlessly. But the contacts do not. Many of the contacts will show an email address under "City" and the phone number under "State". Names get messed up. If I go into Gmail on the web and add a new contact, TB does not sync it at all.

Contrary, the Windows Mail app, Outlook, eM Client etc. all bring in contacts properly.

Some suggestions have been to use an add-on, but many are not compatible with 115 or 116. Besides, shouldn't basic syncing be done without an add-on needed?
creator: bbawt1

title: Please have someone communicate more precisesly with users.
content:
We were repeatedly told that Thunderbird was no longer part of Mozilla, which also implied that it was not to be connected with Firefox, but all questions regarding Thunderbird (and apparently all else) now open a Firefox link!

You have made organizational changes without clarifying those changes to us.

Mozilla now is apparently Firefox, but I surmise that only by what I get when I attempt to go to one of the FOUR related sites I had to sign up for separately a long time ago. Not that anyone has set anything up to direct us to the new "front door," which is the MAIN problem.

Which four? 1) Support.mozilla.org/eng-US/ 2) Bugzilla 3) MozillaZine and Mozilla messaging 4) As well as the unannounced, unshepherded transition of Mozilla now being identified as Firefox.
creator: whldorsey

title: Thunderbird 115.0.1 display glitches
content:
I always thought that some of the best advice is "If it ain't broke, don't fix it." This concerns aspects of 102.13.0 that worked fine, but are glitchy in 115.0.1.

I use Thunderbird to archive from Hotmail (Outlook), AOL, AT&T's Currently (a Yahoo front), and GMail. I am also having to abandon Hotmail (Outlook) because of the characteristic haphazard programming that Microsoft practices, so I have been moving folder contents, sometimes many messages, at a time.

I see that the visual indicators in 115.0.1 is glitchy. I just selected a brace of about 817 emails in a Hotmail folder to be moved to the locally stored Thunderbird folder. After having higlighted the range, when I drag to the Thunderbird folder, only one file shows as being moved, but it stays visible in the source window *and* displays a weak-flash around that one file in the source window.

If I look elsewhere, I can see indication that the files are being moved, but the quirky flashing really looks like there is some error.

When the files to be moved finally all disappear from the source window, I then get a notification that slides in from the top right, saying, "The operation on XXXX failed because there was" and this is the *next* problem, because (1) the window is too small to display the complete message, (2) it slides away much too quickly to be read at a normal pace, (3) there is no way to retrieve and read the complete message, and (4) the movement of emails HAS, in fact, been completed.

title: Suggestion: remove format toolbar for text/plain
content:
I have all my accounts set to send only text/plain messages. But in the message composer, an entire toolbar row (disabled until editor has focus) appears at the head. It should go away, not appear, be hidden.

What would you do if I formatted the message since the account setting is "always plain text?" Unknown.

Also, an entire toolbar line is devoted to presenting "Variables" and "Other" dropdowns. Just two buttons, both of which I will not use in my lifetime.

Removing these spurious items will make the UI more legible, less distracting, professional.

Thanks for the great products. Been using since v 1.0, along side Mosaic, Netscape, and FF.

content: Luego de usar TB or mucho tiempo con varias cuentas de correo diferente, y de actualizar TB a la version 115 tengo problemas para sincronizar la cuenta que tengo con icloud y thunderbird. Uno de los primeros errores que vi fue "The current operation on 'Inbox’ did not succeed. The mail server for account @icloud.com responded: Parse Error (took 0 ms)." En este foro y en https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/ he encontrado alguna dificultad parecida pero las soluciones propuesta ninguna funcióno. Al parecer puedo enviar correos desde TB desde la cuenta de icloud pero no pudo ver en TB ni el correo enviado en la carpeta de send ni los correos recibidos en la carpeta de inbox cuando alguien me envia correos aesta cuenta. Cosa muy diferente si entro en icloud puedo ver tanto los mensajes saliente (que inclusive envié desde TB) como los entrantes. Inclusive implementé la solución planteado para un problema similar en https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1370815 pero tampoco funciónó. Alguien puede ayudarme o tubo el mismo problema?

title: Thunderbird deletes entire inbox instead of just the selected emails
content: Sometimes when I delete a group of emails from my inbox it deleted the entire inbox. It has happened twice now. When it did it yesterday I had 8 emails selected for deletion. When I hit delete it deleted all 2200 emails in the box. When it was deleting them I confirmed that only 8 were selected by looking at the number of selected in the lower right corner of the screen. Worse, when I click undo the delete it does not restore the 2200 deleted but only the 8 that I had selected for deletion. This is a serious bug and has resulted in loss of all my emails over the few years.

title: Convert old CSS snippet to 115
content:
I used to use something like this to reduce the fontsize and remove bold from the folder items... 

   #folderTree > treechildren::-moz-tree-cell-text {      font-size: 75% !important;      font-weight: normal !important;    }

I've looked through this file and tried a few likely options but nothing seems to work...

https://searchfox.org/comm-esr115/source/mail/themes/shared/mail/folderPane.css

Would anyone have a suggestion as to how to convert the above snippet from the old CSS scheme to 115?

Actually, I would also like to change what is bolded in the folder pane to blue (unbold) like the next example for the message thread pane which does work in 115... 

   #threadTree tbody [data-properties~="unread"] {      color: #5FAFFF !important;      font-weight: normal !important;    }

title: When are updates delivered?
content:
SUMo has been notifying me about Thunderbird having an update from my current version 102.13.1.0 to 115.0.1.0, but when I start Thunderbird and have it check for updates, it says it's up to date.

So my question is, after releasing a new version, how much time usually elapses before it is pushed to the auto update mechanisms in regular users' installations?

I'm not sure if a week is a long time here, since maintenance updates do still arrive in the mean time, but I also don't see why this update is held back. After all, updates exist for a good reason, surely.

title: Can’t execute a clean Tbird installation
content:
I’ve used Tbird for 15+ years. I needed to install a new, clean install. Deleted everything from win.10. The minute the new Tbird 115. Tried to install. A pop up window said my password and user name failed to connect to my server Spectrum. no matter how many times I tried latest config. And password . It would continue to reject it. I only have one email address for 15 years. But it keeps rejecting the password. Tried switching from pop3 to IMAP. Can’t get past the log in box. And therefore I can’t get a blank, clean new install. I have deleted every remnant of Tbird. I’ve tried this 30 times this past month. And the same result happens. The pix show what happened the first time I tried to reinstall. Now I can’t even get to those options. All that happens is the constant rejection of either the password or the server domain name. Like spectrum “(mail.two.com) or mail.spectrum.net. Those are Spectrum’s server domain names that always worked. And still do.Just not with MY Tbird. I don’t want to have to surrender and switch to Outlook. I love Tbird. I started using it in the days when it was part of Netscape in 1998.

Please help thanks Michael
creator: expo21
